issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: When adding and removing security group rules at the same time in the "Manage security group rules" dialog an error occurs. The message displayed is: {quote} Could not add new rule to group mygroup. Please try again. Error while committing the transaction {quote} The error in the console logs is: {code} 2012-11-21 15:54:29 INFO 200 POST /ec2?Action=RevokeSecurityGroupIngress (192.168.7.1) 254.47ms 2012-11-21 15:54:29 WARNING 406 POST /ec2?Action=AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress (192.168.7.1) 252.12ms 2012-11-21 15:54:29 ERROR EC2ResponseError: 406 Not Acceptable AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngressTypeError while committing the transactionjavax.persistence.RollbackException: Error while committing the transaction Caused by: javax.persistence.OptimisticLockException Caused by: fields.summary: Error adding and removing security group rule

comments.body: Known issue for 3.2. Need to evaluate if the workflow makes sense.
I moved this one up on the priority list.  This is essentially a must fix for Support for 3.2.1.  We need to figure out how to get this in and get it planned into the current sprint.

The dialog is designed so that a user can add and remove rules within the same dialog. Maybe they want to open one port and close another that was previously opened. They should not have to close and reopen the dialog to do that. I think this should definitely be fixed. Needs reassignment to a developer?
Jenny, can you bring this up with your scrum team and see if this can be done in sprint 1?
[~tony], please reopen the ticket if seen in CI testing.
